publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3046 Mr Mike Rumbles: Prescription Charges—That the Parliament recognises that the criteria used to confer exemption from prescription charges were agreed in 1968; notes that since then many more conditions have been recognised as lifelong and life-threatening; agrees that the state has a responsibility towards those who suffer from these types of condition, and calls on the Scottish Executive to carry out immediately a review of the list of conditions that are exempt from prescription charges.
S1M-3046 Prescription Charges (lodged on 29 April 2002) Robert Brown*
S1M-3046 Prescription Charges (lodged on 29 April 2002) Stewart Stevenson*, Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-3046# Mr Mike Rumbles: Prescription Charges—That the Parliament recognises that the criteria used to confer exemption from prescription charges were agreed in 1968; notes that since then many more conditions have been recognised as lifelong and life-threatening; agrees that the state has a responsibility towards those who suffer from these types of condition, and *considers that the Scottish Executive should* carry out immediately a review of the list of conditions that are exempt from prescription charges. Supported by: Nora Radcliffe*, George Lyon*, Dr Winnie Ewing*, Ms Margo MacDonald*, Donald Gorrie*

S1M-3046# Mr Mike Rumbles: Prescription Charges—That the Parliament recognises that the criteria used to confer exemption from prescription charges were agreed in 1968; notes that since then many more conditions have been recognised as lifelong and life-threatening; agrees that the state has a responsibility towards those who suffer from these types of condition, and considers that the Scottish Executive should carry out immediately a review of the list of conditions that are exempt from prescription charges. Supported by: Robert Brown, Stewart Stevenson, Tommy Sheridan, Nora Radcliffe, George Lyon, Dr Winnie Ewing, Ms Margo MacDonald, Donald Gorrie
S1M-3046# Prescription Charges (lodged on 29 April 2002) Christine Grahame*, Robin Harper*
